intro: Brodiaea grandiflora var. macropoda, commonly known as the large-flowered brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or open habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
